title: Citi Guatemala Fulfills Students' Dreams by Inviting Them to be Part of a Real Workday
summary: Guatemala City, Guatemala - Citi Guatemala and Citi Foundation support the Partners for a Day program, organized by Empresarios Juveniles (Young Entrepreneurs). The objective of this educational event is to bring high school students closer to the work world through a hands-on experience that seeks to reinforce the importance of studying.
tag-1: Citi Guatemala Fulfills Students' Dreams by Inviting Them to be Part of a Real Workday
tag-3: Guatemala City, Guatemala – Citi Guatemala and Citi Foundation support the Partners for a Day program, organized by Empresarios Juveniles (Young Entrepreneurs). The objective of this educational event is to bring high school students closer to the work world through a hands-on experience that seeks to reinforce the importance of studying.
tag-4: Four-hundred-seventy-nine students from different academic institutions of the capital city had the opportunity to partner with more than 46 managers from different companies to share a real workday and learn about corporate life.
tag-5: Since its inception, the Partners for a Day program has helped high-school students discover how the labor world works, by taking a closer look at the pressures of daily activities and discussing what kind of education and skills are necessary for future career paths.
tag-6: "At Citi, we believe that the education of children and young people is the foundation base for a solid society and the necessary tool to foster development. Young people are the future of Guatemala, and our hope at Citi is that they develop their leadership and full potential, "said Juan Miro, Citi Country Officer for Guatemala.
tag-7: This experience was made possible thanks to the Partners for a Day program, which, for the 10th consecutive year, was hosted by Young Entrepreneurs, with Citi Guatemala and Citi Foundation's support.
tag-8: "It's an opportunity for passionate professionals committed to their work to teach and convey a positive message about corporate life to students. We appreciate the participation of more than 46 companies that support us with their managers and professionals to make this program a success," said Jose Herrera, executive director of Young Entrepreneurs.
tag-9: Partners for a Day is also designed to make students value the importance of linking what they have learned in the classroom to its practical labor use, through a real-life experience. In addition, many students gain a new perspective on their potential career choices.
tag-10: "Partners for a Day was an excellent opportunity for students from different institutions to learn about Citi's business sectors, where we could experience the work of employees throughout the course of the work-day. This has allowed me to enhance the approach to my professional career," said Ivonne Liere, a student in her last year at the Emiliana Somascos Institute.

tag-14: Empresarios Juveniles ("Young Entrepreneurs") Youth Entrepreneurs is a nonprofit organization affiliated to Junior Achievement, that helps young generations to foster their entrepreneurial spirit, instruct and foster them to value free enterprise, the economy, and provides the necessary tools for their successful incorporation to business life. The programs are given in Guatemala and also in 110 countries, and are designed for all levels of school education www.ejguate.org.
